framework.name: AI Bias Assessment and Mitigation Framework
framework.description: A framework for assessing and mitigating bias in AI systems throughout the development lifecycle.

risks.title: Biased Data Sources
risks.definition: The selected data sources may contain inherent biases or lack diversity, leading to biased AI models.

risks.title: Preprocessing-Induced Bias
risks.definition: Data preprocessing techniques, such as feature selection or data cleaning, may introduce or amplify biases in the data.

risks.title: Inadequate Bias Assessment
risks.definition: Failure to conduct comprehensive assessments to identify potential biases in the training data may result in biased AI models.

risks.title: Algorithmic Bias
risks.definition: The chosen algorithms may have inherent biases or may amplify biases present in the training data.

risks.title: Training Data Bias
risks.definition: The training data used to develop the AI model may contain biases, leading to biased model outputs.

risks.title: Inadequate Performance Metrics
risks.definition: The selected performance metrics may not adequately capture the fairness and bias aspects of the AI model.

risks.title: Undetected Residual Bias
risks.definition: The testing process may fail to identify and quantify residual biases present in the trained AI model.

risks.title: Fairness Drift
risks.definition: The fairness properties of the AI model may degrade over time due to changes in the underlying data or environment.

risks.title: Insufficient Monitoring
risks.definition: The monitoring processes may not effectively detect emerging biases or fairness issues in the deployed AI system.
